p: Major producers of sesame are Tanzania, India, Myanmar, China, Sudan, Ethiopia and Nigeria, in this order [ 5, 6]. Landraces and locally grown varieties of sesame show conspicuous diversity, supposedly resulting from selection of variants by farmers and possibly also from repeated domestications [ 3]. In spite of its age and economical importance for local economies, sesame is regarded as an orphan crop and research devoted to sesame has been scarce; for instance, sesame is not mandated by any international crop research center [ 6].
